info.title: BadBeatMods API
info.description:
This isn't really fully complete, but its better than absolutely nothing.

This API documentation is automatically generated and therefor may not be 100% accurate and may be missing a few fields. For example, request bodies are not fully fleshed out, and may not be accurate. Full documentation is still currently a work in progress.

All errors that originate from the server will have a `message` field. Errors that come from input validation will sometimes also have an `errors` field. This has been omiitted from the documentation of most endpoints for brevity. These follow the `ServerMessage` schema.

tags.name: Games
tags.description: Game, GameVersion, category, and webhook management

tags.name: Bulk Actions
tags.description: Actions that allow you to skip calling the same endpoint over and over again

get.description:
Legacy BeatMods API endpoint. This is available for mod downloaders that have not been updated to use the new API.

This endpoint does not work the same way as the old BeatMods API, but it should be close enough to work with most mod downloaders.

parameters.name: gameVersion
parameters.description: The game version as a string (ex. '1.29.1', '1.40.0').

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The statuses to return. Available statuses are: 'approved' & 'all'

get.summary: Get all mods for a specified version.
get.description:
Get all mods.

If gameName is not provided, it will default to Beat Saber.
If gameVersion is not provided, it will default to whatever is set as the lastest version for the selected game.

parameters.name: gameVersion
parameters.description: The game version (ex. '1.29.1', '1.40.0'). This parameter is required for dependency resolution to work.

total.description: The total number of mods before checking dependencies.

invalidCount.description: The number of mods that were removed due to missing dependencies.

items.description: The IDs of the versions that were removed due to missing dependencies.

get.description: Get multiple versions by ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The version IDs. Can be specified multiple times.

200.description: Returns the version and the parent project.

get.summary: Get a specific mod version that has a file with the specified hash.
get.description: Get a specific mod version that has a file with the specified hash. This is useful for finding the mod that a file belongs to.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Only show versions with these statuses.

get.summary: Get a specific mod version that has a file with the specified hash.
get.description: Look up multiple hashes at once, and sort the results by hash. Developed for PinkModManager.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: The hash to look up. Can be repeated

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Only show versions with these statuses.

get.summary: Get a specific project by ID.
get.description: Get a specific project by ID. This will also return every version associated with the project.

get.summary: Get a specific version by ID.
get.description: Get a specific version by ID.

post.description: Upload a new version to a project.
Update a project icon. (Note: This endpoint does not work on the API documentation page.)

get.description: Get all edits.
Get an edit.
Get user information.
Logout.
Returns a list of all games and their versions.

parameters.name: shouldShowVersions
parameters.description: Whether to include versions in the response.

200.description: Returns a list of games with their versions.

get.description: Returns a specific game and its versions by name.

post.summary: Add a version to a game.
post.description: Adds a new version to the specified game.

requestBody.description: The version to add to the game.

post.summary: Add a category to a game.
post.description: Adds a new category to the specified game. The `Core`, `Essentials`, and `Other` categories cannot be added, removed, or have their position changed.

put.summary: Remove a category from a game.
put.description: Removes a category from the specified game. The `Core`, `Essentials`, and `Other` categories cannot be removed or have their position changed.

requestBody.description: The category to add or remove from the game.

items.description: The category to add or remove from the game.

delete.summary: Remove a category from a game.
delete.description: Removes a category from the specified game. The `Core`, `Essentials`, and `Other` categories cannot be added, removed, or have their position changed.

get.description: Returns a list of webhooks for the specified game.

post.summary: Add a webhook to a game.
post.description: Adds a new webhook to the specified game.

requestBody.description: The webhook to add to the game.

types.description: The types of events the webhook should listen to.

put.summary: Update the types setup for a webhook config.
put.description: Updates the types setup for a webhook config.

requestBody.description: The gameName and version to create
The ID of the version to set as default

get.summary: Check if all hashes are valid & present.
get.description: Check if all hashes are valid & their files are still present on the server.

get.description: Check if all icons are valid & their files are still present on the server.

post.description: Sort game versions within versions by a gameversions version using SemVer

post.summary: Load blank file sizes into the database.
post.description: Check each record in the modVersions table. If the file size is 0, attempt to get the file size from the zip file.

post.description: Move a mod version to a new mod.

versionId.description: The mod version ID to move.

newModId.description: The new mod ID to move the version to.

post.summary: Add a game version to multiple versions
post.description: Add a game version to multiple versions. Submits edits if the version is already approved, otherwise queues an edit for approval. Requires the user to be an approver.
Submits edits if the version is already approved, otherwise queues an edit for approval. Requires the user to be an approver.
Approve multiple edit requests. Requires the user to be an approver.

ServerMessage.description: A simple message from the server. Indicates anything from a successful operation to an error message. Most, if not all, endpoints will return this in the event of an error.

ServerMessageWithErrorStringArray.description: A simple message from the server. Indicates anything from a successful operation to an error message. Most, if not all, endpoints will return this in the event of an error.

ApprovalQueueResponse.description: A list of items in the approval queue.

ProjectVersionPairResponse.description: Returns a project and version pair (e.g. a mod).

ProjectVersionsPairResponse.description: Returns a project and version pair (e.g. a mod). `versions` is a list of all visible versions for a project.

GameWebhookConfigResponse.description: Returns the webhook configuration for a game.

id.description: The ID of the webhook configuration.

GameCategoryBody.description: The category to add or remove from the game.

category.description: The category to add or remove from the game.

WebhookTypeConfigBody.description: The configuration for a webhook type.

types.description: The types of events to log for this webhook.

raw.name: raw
raw.description: If set to true, the response will be altered to return a non-processed version of the object. The resulting response will not have the same structure as the public response. This parameter is used for debugging purposes.

description.description: The description of the project. Supports markdown.
description.example: This is an example project. It is used as an example for the API documentation.

gameName.description: The name of the game this project is for. Must be a game that is returned by the /games endpoint.

reason.description: The reason for the status change. This is used to track the history of the project's status.
reason.example: This project is currently in development.

userId.description: The ID of the user who changed the status.

setAt.description: The date the status was changed.

createdAt.description: The date the object was added to the database.

updatedAt.description: The date the object was last updated.

modVersion.description: The version string. This is used to identify the version of the mod. This must be SemVer compliant.

zipHash.description: The hash of the zip file. This is used to find and download the zip file. Will be a MD5 hash.

parentId.description: The ID of the project this version depends on.

sv.description: The comapre version string. This is used to identify the version of the mod. This must be SemVer compliant.

createdAt.description: The date the object was added to the database.

updatedAt.description: The date the object was last updated.

sponsorUrl.description: The URL to support the user's works financially.

displayName.description: The user's display name from GitHub. Is editable after registration, and can be different from the GitHub username/display name.

siteide.description: Site-wide roles. Takes precedence over per-game roles.

bio.description: The user's bio from GitHub. Is editable after registration. Supports markdown.

createdAt.description: The date the object was added to the database.

updatedAt.description: The date the object was last updated.

deletedAt.description: The date the object was deleted from the database.

id.description: The ID of the game version.

gameName.description: The name of the game this version is for. This is the same as the name field in the Game object.

defaultVersion.description: Whether this version is the default version for the game.

linkedVersionIds.description: The IDs of the linked versions. This is used to link multiple versions of the same game together.

displayName.description: The display name of the game.

APIStatus.description: The status & additional information of the API.

veryImportantMessage.example: pink cute, era cute, lillie cute, william gay

isDocker.description: Whether the API is running in Docker or not.
